category: assailent, bo, boxing-quotes, combat-training, defence-quotes, fast, fighting, jutsu, karate, kobudo, kobudo-quotes, kung-fu, martial-arts, okinawa, old-karate, pain, powerful, prowess, quotes, ryukyu, sensei, shorinjiryu, tanbo, teacher, teachers-and-learners, teaching-quotes, tegumi, toifa, torite, tudi, wrestling-practice

quote: The principle is this: that in everything worth having, even in every pleasure, there is a point of pain and tedium that must be survived, so that the pleasure may revive and endure. The joy of battle comes after the first fear of death; the joy of reading Virgil comes after the bore of learning him; the glow of the seabather comes after the icy shok of the sea bath.
author: G.K. Chesterton, What's Wrong with the World

quote: Let go of the pain. Dwell on positive thoughts.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: disappointment, good-thoughts, motivational, pain, positive, positive-thinking, self-help, self-love, survival-instinct

quote: Pain ebbs, And like cool balm, An opiate weariness Settles on eye-lids, on relaxed Pale wrists.
author: Adelaide Crapsey, Verse by Adelaide Crapsey

quote: If itWere lighter touchThan petal of flower restingOn grass, oh still too heavy it were,Too heavy!
author: Adelaide Crapsey, Verse by Adelaide Crapsey

quote: Three grey women walk with me Fate and Grief and Memory. My fate brought grief; my grief must be With me through Eternity, Such thy power, memory.Three grey women walk with me.
author: Adelaide Crapsey, Verse by Adelaide Crapsey

quote: Losing something she loved had ripped her open in a way she had not expected. The pain hurt, but the pain was right. The Order had wrought a galaxy in which good capitulated to evil, where human feelings—Aryn’s feelings—were crushed under the weight of Jedi nonattachment.
author: Paul S. Kemp, Deceived

quote: Do you know what hurts so much? It's love. Love is the strongest force in the world, and when it is blocked that means pain. There are two things we can do when that happens. We can kill the love so that it stops hurting. But then of course part of use dies, too. Or, Corrie, we can ask God to open up another route for that love to travel.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: Pain was simply an inevitability of living, and I had to learn how to trust him with his own, as I trusted him with mine.
author: Alexis  Hall, For Real

quote: I hated myself, and the part of me that was cowardly wished for a simple solution: an exchange of pain for forgiveness. But life didn’t work that way, and fucking up was forever.
author: Alexis  Hall, For Real

quote: Amy had always thought she was too vain and selfish to seriously contemplate suicide, also too afraid of pain. She realized now that when she'd thought that, she hadn't understood how painful existence could get. It could get so painful, it turned out, that any other kind of pain began to seem preferable. She felt ridiculous thinking these goth-teenager thoughts, but they were real.
author: Emily Gould, Friendship
category: depressed, depression, existence, goth, pain, suicide

quote: I fall asleep with the sound of her voice echoing in my head, and a feeling in my chest like someone is scooping my heart out with a spoon.
author: Melissa Keil, Life in Outer Space
category: fear, heart, humor, love, pain, sleep

quote: Fear,” she says, “is more powerful than pain.
author: Veronica Roth, Insurgent

quote: Life is too short to miss out on anything, even if it's pain.
author: J.T. Geissinger

quote: It hurt like hell, but at least it felt true. Her mind could settle into that pain.
author: Faith McKay, Lipstick & Zombies

quote: When do we stop crying over our own injuries? When we get old enough to swallow our tears, or when the people we love stop responding to our cries of pain?
author: Carol Cassella, Oxygen

quote: You're too scared of what it means to feel anything that matters. You're scared to love, and you hide behind this mission to destroy the code.
author: Heidi Tankersley, The Mod Code

quote: These souls were eternally disconnected, forever separated with a force that would not allow any interchange. They were like another race with no societal tie to each other, bound on their own miserable, independent journeys, alike only in the obvious countenance of pain.
author: R. William Bennett, Jacob T. Marley

quote: Adapt to any situation.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: adversity, challenges, circumstance, failure, faith, fighting-spirit, hope, never-give-up, overcoming-obstacles, pain, positive-thinking, problems, situation

quote: Sometimes the greatest pain, is the one we think we can’t control.
author: Dugald Black

quote: If the pain is not felt or it doesn't hurt you...it can never change you. Being susceptible to pain is a blessing.
author: Mamur Mustapha
category: blessing, change, character, life, pain, people, strength

quote: Birthing is never easy or without pain, be it a universe, a child, or a fresh start in life. Contraction precedes expansion. Darkness comes before dawn. Joy follows pain. This is the way of things.
author: John Mark Green
category: birthing, change, contraction, darkness, dawn, expansion, joy, life-quotes, new-start, pain, positive-quotes, quotes-about-life, rebirth, starting-over, universe

quote: Jealousy from a love affair is something even God can admit.
author: Criss Jami, Healology
category: adultery, adultery-and-attitude, affair, attitude, caring, cheater, cherishing, commitment, commitment-and-attitude, dedication, devotion, engagement, envy, faithfulness, fornication, god, heart, heartache, heartache-love, heartbreak, honesty, honor, idolatry, infidelity, integrity, jealousy, love, love-affair, loyalty, marriage, marriage-vows, obey, pain, passion, promise, relationship, sex, trustworthiness, vows, vows-marriage, worship

quote: Opening to love will always involve risk,but a heart safe from pain is one also locked to joy.
author: John Mark Green
category: heart, love, love-quotes, pain, quotes-about-love, risk, vulnerability, vulnerability-quotes

quote: The realization that my parents, too, felt pain and fear frightened me more than any strangers could.
author: Sara Nović, Girl at War

quote: There are some silences that are so huge, and fraught, and haunted, and weighed, and shocked, that they just are; there's nothing you can say about them that makes any sense. All you can do is witness them, and feel some deep ache that such things arrive, and must be endured, with wordless aching all around.
author: Brian  Doyle, The Plover

quote: You need to calm down and remember that everyone grieves differently. Doesn't mean they don't care. You don't judge people in pain, and you damn sure don't lash out at them when they've lost what Syn has!
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Born of Betrayal

quote: Comedy is not the opposite of darkness, but its natural bedfellow. Pain makes laughter necessary; laughter makes pain tolerable.
author: Mindy Greenstein
category: comedy, depression, humor, laughter, laughter-is-the-best-medicine, pain

quote: When our stoicism interferes with our humanity, we risk developing a wooden emotional life and an equally wooden personality. In contrast, the realization that our ability to work through pain makes us stronger than all of our efforts to exorcise it may in the long run alleviate its burden. It may enable us to take up our destiny as creatures whose very vulnerability renders us capable of inspired and truly awe-inspiring love.
author: Mari Ruti, The Summons of Love

quote: May the Lord revive the crushed spirit.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: broken-heart, broken-hearted, christian, emotional, encouragement, faith, god, healing, hope, hurt, inspirational, pain, prayer, religion, revive, self-help, spirit, uplifting

quote: You ought to the read stories of how people have endured worst situation. You will find the strength to survive life.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: adversity, circumstance, dark-times, difficulties-of-life, emotional-pain, encouragement, endurance, fighting-spirit, inner-strength, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, learning, obstacles, overcomer, overcoming-challenges, pain, posit, positive-thinking, read, reading, self-determination, self-worth, situation, stories, survival-instinct

quote: Imagine you are tied to a chair with your hands tightly bound behind you, preventing you from covering your ears. Before you is a giant chalkboard. A woman enters the room. Her fingernails are long, hard, and ready for attack. You follow her with your eyes as she saunters to the chalkboard and raises her hand to make a claw. She looks at you with a blank stare as she digs her fingernails into the chalkboard and drags downward. As the harsh sound hits your ears, you squeeze your eyes shut in an instinctive yet vain effort to shut out the noise, but the absence of sight only magnifies the vile sound. Your ears have become hypersensitive, and you feel an unpleasant chill shoot through your body down to the toes of your feet. Finally, the sound stops as she removes her nails from the board, and a wave of relief passes over you. But the reprieve is short-lived. Again, the nails dig into the board and screech all the way down. The process repeats itself several times, and each time she stops dragging, you think it has ended for good, but soon she starts all over again. You frantically call out to her and ask her why she is doing this. You wonder what you have done to earn this perpetual torture. But she only looks back at your with a blank, almost quizzical stare, and that is when you realize that she is unaware of the pain she is causing. You feel the hopelessness pass over you. You squirm to free yourself from the chair, but it's no use. This is your life now, listening to this terribly unpleasant sound with no way to stop it. Sometimes she leaves, but she always comes back to repeat the scene, oblivious to the torture she creates.
author: Rachel Cinelli
category: hearing, misophonia, noise, pain, sound-sensitivity, sounds, torture

quote: It's Painful Experiences... That Makes You Wise!
author: Ibrahim Khidair Ali
category: experience, motivation, pain, painful, strength, wisdom

quote: Instantaneous forgiveness can bring longstanding self-preservation, not to mention a cheaper Ralph's bill on Rolaids.
author: Ace Antonio Hall

quote: If you read stories, you find the strength, faith and hope to survive everyday life.

quote: No matter what happens, you can make it. Like a fist tightened as hard as possible, you can always apply more.
author: Ace Antonio Hall

quote: Whatever unspeakable act done to you, write it down, read it, then ball up the paper & sling it hard into the wall. Expunge it from your soul

quote: Pain strengthens and failure teaches us the proper way to do things.

quote: May the broken hearted be healed.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: Ava turned to the side, staring out into the dark. In profile, her face was suddenly tired and sad, and Cole felt the urge to wrap himself around her. To protect her from whatever was dragging her down.
author: Danika Stone, Intaglio: Dragons All The Way Down

quote: Pain and love cannot be in the same space. You can never love anyone in pain. You cannot truly love yourself in pain. The more pain you carry in your heart, the harder it becomes to love anyone including yourself.

category: forgiveness, hard-times-in-your-life, hardship, heal, healing, healing-the-past, heart, heartbreak, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, love, loving-others, loving-someone, loving-yourself, pain, painful, painful-memories, truth

quote: Sadness is a bruise on the skin of memory.

quote: People have so much pain inside them that they’re not even aware of.
author: Marina Abramović

quote: Let's live a lie for today.You’ll spin talesand pretend to love me.And I'll smile
author: you’ll not realize it’s fakeThen I’ll pretendyour pretensions don’t cause me pain.

quote: Healing severe or chronic pain, I believe, includes transforming our relationship to the pain, and, ultimately, it is about transforming our relationship to who we are and to life.
author: Sarah Anne Shockley, The Pain Companion: Practical Tools for Living With & Moving Beyond Chronic Pain

quote: We are, or rather our natural desire to evade pain and to attain pleasure is, the primary reason we do or say every single thing we do or say.
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana, The Selfish Genie: A Satirical Essay on Altruism

author: Melissa Cady, Paindemic: A Practical and Holistic Look at Chronic Pain, the Medical System, and the antiPAIN Lifestyle

quote: Ill usage makes the sweetest of us vicious.
author: Winston Graham, Ross Poldark

quote: When sorrow's cup is filled up to the brim,the slightest touch of memory can cause tears to spill again.

quote: With positive attitude and persistent endurance, you can overcome any challenge.

quote: There is a little furnace within every heart that burns pain. It is formed by a masonry of scars as tick by tick the tireless mechanics of life strip the innocence bestowed upon us at birth. There are some in whom life builds the furnace small and controllable, a passionate heat to burn off the losses, the harsh words and petty disappointments, leaving us cleaner for it. There are others. There are those whose innocence is assaulted early and with such brutality, that it goes beyond all the boundaries of deities and angels to stray into the world of unfettered evil. They build their furnaces differently.
author: Robert E. Dunn, The Red Highway

quote: How much easier life was once you learned how to lie. I had gotten into trouble by speaking out of turn, arguing and answering back so many times. Not anymore. Now I would do what I wanted, and no one would stop me.
author: Zoë Marriott, Shadows on the Moon

quote: We need to develop new strategies overcome every challenge.

quote: The Lord healed all our wounds.

category: christian-life, faith, forgiveness, hope, inspiration, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, pain, spiritual

quote: Some people are in misery of carrying the entire world’s pain on their shoulders. They are called writers.
author: M.F. Moonzajer, LOVE, HATRED AND MADNESS
category: authors, misery, pain, world, writers, writing

quote: Spread love, joy and compassion because the world needs it, for hatred and pain need no escort; they know how to survive without it.
author: Radhika Mundra
category: compassion, hatred, joy, love, pain, survival

quote: Ileni swallowed hard. "Yes," she said. "I am. But it's all going to be the same, for a very long time. The sorcerers will have all the power, and the assassins will eventually regather and start attacking again... and I haven't made any difference at all.""Well," Evin said, "I think you've made quite a bit of difference to the people whose lives you saved. Speaking as one of them."She stepped away from the edge, closer to him. "Do you regret it?" he asked evenly.His face was half-shadowed, but his eyes were bright and piercing. Not wide with pain and devoid of hope. She felt again his hand, limp and helpless in hers. Felt it tighten as Sorin plummeted past the gray rock. "No," she said. And for at least that moment, it was entirely true.
author: Leah Cypess, Death Marked

quote: Do the roots reveal everything to the branches, or do they keep what is painful to themselves?
author: Sinan Antoon

quote: Love never betrays. People do.
author: Rohit  Sharma

quote: Pain, sometimes, is like Love. It grows, until it becomes your Life.
author: Rohit  Sharma

quote: Cold has its own taste. It tastes of a bitten tongue. It coils around you, a living thing, a beast that means to kill you, not with wrath, not with tooth nor claw, but with the mercy of surrender, with the kindness of letting you go gentle into the long night after such a burden of pain and misery.
author: Mark  Lawrence, Prince of Fools
category: burden, claw, cold, gentle, kill, kindness, living, mercy, misery, night, pain, surrender, taste, thing, tongue, tooth, wrath

quote: Love, the emotion that should elicit healing, was in fact the most painful emotion of them all. It crept in when you didn’t want it. Made itself at home, terrorizing your hormones with confusion. It made you more susceptible to pain, it weakened your resolve while simultaneously making you frantic with need. And it hurt. Not just mentally, but physically.

quote: I suffered in my spirit, so that my soul will be restored.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: My heart had been crush torn and crumble but I'm still here and I'm not broken I'm still fighting my way out
author: Joyce Guo

quote: .......Love is such a biological feeling, which kills, without killing you biologically.
author: Farooq A. Shiekh

quote: I can write about it if I am careful, if I keep it far enough away.
author: Kij Johnson, At the Mouth of the River of Bees: Stories

quote: You can comfort me with your words and your gifts but it can not comfort me with the pain you gave

quote: How we choose to deal with pain is ultimately the measure of who we are and of the success we have in closing our gaps.
author: Hyrum W. Smith, The 3 Gaps: Are You Making a Difference?

quote: Vesper felt herself turning red with humiliation. Then she looked at Allegra—really looked at her. Maybe she’d had such a problem with people not seeing her because she wasn’t seeing them. Did Allegra’s mask of rage hide pain and doubt that anyone would ever truly love her? She thought that it just might. Vesper didn’t quite feel compassion, but she no longer took Allegra’s behavior personally.

quote: Doctors says it is impossible to live without a heart, but is extremely unbelievable to see how many heartless humans are living in this strange world. Humans proved it once again that nothing is IMPOSSIBLE, even living without a heart.
author: Angela ShahAnwar

quote: I waited and waited I wonder if there's something wrong with me. I've been alone and abandoned. I wondered if I will I be love will I know happiness. I can stay in this darkness forever but then again I can walk towards a light of hope. There only obstacle is me.
author: Joyce Guo

quote: Sure relationships include arguments, but pain is not a side-effect of love.

quote: I think that modern medicine has become like a prophet offering a life free of pain. It is nonsense. The only thing I know that truly heals people is unconditional love.
author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross
category: free, heals, medicine, modern, nonsense, pain, people, prophet, unconditional-love

quote: How much pain a person detains may be proportionate to the pain they spare others when they'd rather hurt than hurt another.

category: hurting, offending, pain, sadness, selfless, suffering

quote: I wonder if it's meant to be punishment for something one can't forgive oneself for. Or an external expression, Lady Queen, of an internal pain? Or perhaps it's a way to realise that you actually do want to stay alive.

quote: Never say you understand someone's pain if you haven't felt the same, because not only would you sound mocking but also ignorant.

quote: If you hear a song that makes you cry and you don’t want to cry anymore, you don’t listen to that song anymore. But you can’t get away from yourself. You can’t decide not to see yourself anymore. You can’t decide to turn off the noise in you head.

quote: The pain of being treated like a mere object. And a sense that this pain would turn into pleasure.

quote: Enough pain makes a coward of anyone.

quote: Let go of all your hurt and be healed.

quote: I said that " I love you ", and there's no responce from you.It's like i am eating a dark chocolate,too bitter

quote: I had one of those headaches. It kept pounding and got into that crazy realm where the guillotine seems like a good idea.

quote: You ask me to write you a poem,I pen you an empty ocean,You run away.You ask me who I am,I paint you a breaking sky,You weep in the rain.

quote: I wish I could tell him that we’re going through the same thing. I wish I could speak to him like I want to instead of like I’m supposed to. But the idea of admitting that I need help is too much to bear, so I turn away.

quote: I wish she could see how it hits him. The look on his face, his life caving in. Because then maybe she’d realize, if only for a split second, that even though the world doesn’t matter to her, she matters to the world.

quote: Happiness isn’t about pretending there’s no pain. It’s about accepting the pain as a part of healing and doing your best to nurse your own wounds with love and patience.

author: Jenim Dibie, The Calligraphy of God

quote: I don't understand how the pain of losing him can be a pale shadow in comparison to the pain of finding him again.

quote: There are two things that may happen to a person: the first is that you become so soft that no one and nothing can break you, and the second is that you become so hard that nothing and no one can break you. Either way you go, the path will be very painful. But herein is the great sadness of it all: that anyone must try to become something that cannot be broken (whether the soft or the hard). Why must we be born into a world where we must spend our lives struggling to become unbreakable?
author: C. JoyBell C.
category: becoming-unbreakable, broken-people, hurt, inspirational-life, inspirational-quotes, life-and-living, pain, saddness, struggling, the-difficulty-of-life, the-struggle-of-life, unbreakable, wisdom-quote

quote: That sassy low classy, but dress real cheap-fly-n-fancy, with a chip on her shoulder -- she's just a bitterly wounded dove, wanting to be sieged by love.

quote: But these are small troubles, people will say. Yes, but they are drops which wear hollows in the rock.

quote: When you're a kid you have these notions about how things are going to be.... You get a little older and you pull back on some of that. I think you wind up just tryin to minimize the pain.

quote: Weeping Widows"There is a river that cuts ThroughThe heart of EveAnd flows throughParadise's back window.It streams into A bottomless wellThat rolls down to hellWith the tears of theWeeping widows.The women stand along the well,And cryWhile singing gray lullabiesAs orphaned childrenLight up candles to put on palm leavesTo push into the streamWith petals of jasmine And pieces of tangerine,Then sit back and wait for their fatherTo show up over the horizon Where his heart still beatsIn their dreams.

quote: Then dawns the Invisible; the Unseen its truth reveals;My outward sense is gone, my inward essence feels:Its wings are almost free--its home, its harbour found,Measuring the gulph, it stoops and dares the final bound,"Oh I dreadful is the check--intense the agony--When the ear begins to hear, and the eye begins to see;When the pulse begins to throb, the brain to think again;The soul to feel the flesh, and the flesh to feel the chain.

quote: Someone once told me that when you die every deed you ever committed, whether on behalf of good or bad is represented in the form of pebbles. Black ones for every deed done in the name of evil, white ones for every act of good. The pebbles are weighed upon a great scale, and if the white stones outweigh the black then your soul is granted peace.”He opens one bleary eye. “What’s the punishment for too many black acts?”“There is no worse punishment than standing on the threshold of heaven alone.
author: Ellis Adler
category: confusion, death, insight, love, pain, scifi, weakness, ya

quote: I have lived in the shadow of loss—the kind of loss that can paralyze you forever.I have grieved like a professional mourner—in every waking moment, draining every ounce of my life force.I died—without leaving my body.But I came back, and now it’s your turn.I have learned to remember my past—without living in it.I am strong, electric, and alive, because I chose to dance, to laugh, to love, and tolive again.I have learned that you can’t re-create the life you once had—you have toreinvent a life for yourself.And that reinvention is a gift, not a curse.I believe your future self is a work of art and that science can help you create it. If you’re lost . . . if you’re gone . . . if you can barely absorb the words on thispage . . . I want you to hold this truth in your heart: when it’s your time to go, you won’t wish you had spent more time grieving; you’ll wish you had spent more time living.That’s why I’m here. And why you are, too. Let’s live like our lives depend on it.
author: Christina Rasmussen, Second Firsts Live Laugh and Love Again
category: grief, grief-and-loss-quotes, grief-inspirational, grief-support, life, life-and-death, life-and-living, life-changing-inspirational, life-lesson, life-quotes-and-sayings, loss, love, pain, resilience, sorrow

author: Margaret Atwood, The Blind Assassin
category: hurt, ignorance, knowledge, learning, lies, loss, pain, philosophy, philosophy-of-life

quote: It was wrong to want to touch a scar and call it beautiful.

quote: I do believe God gave me a spark of genius, but he quenched it in misery.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: ...her own restless coveting of his love and the slow but sure ebullience of her desire for him; then the Nawab's martydom and her spiritual homelessness and physical loneliness; there was so much, so many portraits and landscapes, like the bright pages of an album of words and pictures. They filled her heart overflowing with the tangy, coppery taste of blood that flows from failure, and pricked her soul with nostalgia, for what was and what could have been. She had never thought that happy memories could come accompanied with so much regret, so much pain, so much repining, and discontent. If you plucked a rose without due care, its thorn pricked you to protest the thoughtlessness and the inconsiderateness you had displayed in taking away its crowning glory. Here, it was nothing else but the rose which was the thorn: its each and every petal was saturated with the scents of the past but it stung like the scorpion plant. But was it possible not to touch those memories? For their scents traveled in and out of your being like breath, and their colours were inside every blink of your eye.
author: Shamsur Rahman Faruqi, The Mirror of Beauty
category: love, melancholy, memories, nostalgia, pain, regret

quote: Her shut-eyed smile transformed itself into something else: the smile of someone brave and knowing, someone whose pain had made her wise.
author: Wally Lamb, She's Come Undone

quote: If there is anything certain in life, it is this. Time doesn't always heal. Not really. I know they say it does, but that is not true. What time does is to trick you into believing that you have healed, that the hurt of a great loss has lessened. But a single word, a note of a song, a fragrance, a knife point of dawn light across an empty room, any one of these things will take you back to that one moment you have never truly forgotten. These small things are the agents of memory. They are the sharp needle points piercing the living fabric of your life.Life, my children, isn't linear where the heart is concerned. It is filled with invisible threads that reach out from your past and into your future. These threads connect every second we have lived and breathed. As your own lives move forward and as the decades pass, the more of these threads are cast. Your task is to weave them into a tapestry, one that tells the story of the time we shared.
author: Stephen Lee
category: fragrance, future, healing, heart, hurt, life, loss, memory, pain, past, sadness, song, sorrow, story, time, wounds

quote: Lords of fire and earth and water,Lords of moon and wind and sky,Come now to the Old Man's daughter,Come from fathers long gone by.Bring blue from a distance eye.Lords of water, earth, and fire,Lords of wind and snow and rain,Give to my heart's desire.Life as all life comes with pain,But blue will come to us again.
author: Madeleine L'Engle, A Swiftly Tilting Planet
category: blue, desire, earth, eye, fire, heart, lords, moon, pain, rain, sky-life, snow, water, wind

quote: Life is a never-ending process of growth and learning. We can welcome this growth, or choose to reject it. But, the healthy thing to do is welcome it with open arms, no matter how painful or hurtful the lesson may be. Because, if it is in your life, you can be fairly certain that it is there for a reason.We often hear that some of the most significant life change comes about as a result of great pain and suffering. It is comforting to know that on the other side of darkness and despair exists hope, excitement and anticipation for the future and its possibilities.
author: Valerie Rickel

quote: May all of you who stay behind, wake up and see that life’s a lie,May all of you breathing today, come to join our tribe of peace!To all who seek the breath of life, wake up today and see the truth. To all of you who fear Azrael, why fear the one setting us free? May all of you who think I’m dead, come see my face in the parade.
author: Quetzal

quote: It is no better if your son rapes a woman than when your daughter gets raped. It is equally painful, may be more.~ Rudransh Kashyap
author: Kirtida Gautam, #iAm16iCan
category: courage, pain, parenting, parenting-advice, parenting-quotes, parenting-teens, raising-boys, rape, rape-myths, rape-recovery, rudransh-kashyap, sex-education

quote: Some scars don't hurt. Some scars are numb. Some scars rid you of the capacity to feel anything ever again.
author: Joyce Rachelle
category: betrayal, emotional-abuse, hurt, indifference, numb, pain, scars, trust

quote: The pain, I can assure you, will be exquisite.
author: Clive Barker, The Forbidden
category: horror, masochism, pain, sadochism, seductive, sex

quote: Some days you feel like you're the worst of sinners
author: others like you're the most righteous person on earth. I am convinced that the former is when you're closest to God.

quote: The Batcave is a monument… to his pain. The cave is more than his war room. He might think of it that way, all the tools and resources he’s assembled for his work. But that’s not it at all. The Batcave is a monument to his pain. And this morning, the way he’s hurting, it was the last place he would come.
author: Chris Dee, World's Finest: Red Cape, Big City

quote: He considered that a moment, rolling the sweet over his tongue. "There are times when it is entirely safe to show one's vulnerability, to roll over and reveal the soft underbelly beneath. But there are other times when pain must be borne without a murmur, when the pain is so consuming that if you give in to it, even in the slightest, you have lost everything.
author: Deanna Raybourn, A Curious Beginning

quote: Being strong doesn't mean that you never break! Being strong means that even if you break into a million pieces, you still have the courage to pick those pieces up, put them back together, and keep going on.
author: Manprit Kaur
category: attitude, being, being-strong, break, courage, emotional-strength, heart, hold-on, keep-going-on, life, move-on, never-give-up, pain, past, strength

quote: The difference is,Now I cant call you anymore…I cant hear your calming voice,I cant hear your wordsThat made me always feel better,Now I am just all aloneIn this dark and cold room
author: JJM
category: alone, broken, broken-heart, dark, darkness, depressed, depression, heartbreak, lonely, love, pain, sad, sadness

quote: Let go of all your hurts and be healed.

quote: Just because you can't see the wound doesn't mean it isn't hurting.
author: Jodi Picoult, The Pact

quote: I missed him so much that it felt like a physical pain in the area below my ribs. I opened my mouth to accommodate it. I put my hand to it. A hollow, aching, piercing place.
author: Marya Hornbacher, The Center of Winter

quote: I caught a red bird once, I fell in love with her,Took the red bird home with me,I saw her eyes, at saw my peace,I love the red bird much, I cut her wings, I wanted the bird to stay, I made a cage for her,No wings, and trapped, the red bird cried, I saw her eyes in pain; it broke my heart to see,I was the one to blame, for the red bird’s pain, It grew back its wings, no longer in the cage,She looked at me once more, spread its wings and left,I loved that red bird still; I wish she was with meBut now I know for sure , her pain was caused by me.
author: Quetzal

quote: Everyone’s searching for someone to end the pain of loneliness. Even the darkest of souls wants a shot at redemption.
author: Katherine McIntyre, Soul Solution
category: loneliness, lonely, pain, quotes-about-loneliness, redemption, shot-at-happiness

quote: It is not fit that I should give myself pain, for I have never intentionally given pain even to another.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: What happens to us are tiny matters compare to us response to any situation.

quote: …because it is natural to touch more often the parts that hurt.
author: Seneca

quote: She sobbed the way she did everything else- with passion and excess.
author: Jodi Picoult, The Pact

quote: She had thought about that moment so often during the past few years it had dried out. It was stale, like old, odourless potpourri. But she still want back to it, because it was the only one.
author: Cassandra Rose Clarke, The Mad Scientist's Daughter

quote: All at once, she was confronted with the full understanding of it. And if she admitted it to herself, she could only be left with the grotesque truth. She didn’t want to let go of the pain. She didn’t want it to be lessened. She wanted to carry it. And whatever path she took from this point forward would serve to take it away.
author: Dorothy Gravelle, Paradox Love

quote: I don't like it when it stings,' he said. 'Nobody does.
author: J.D. Salinger, Nine Stories

quote: The greater the injury, the greater the fun.
author: Leinad Eibam, a celebration of poets, Summer 2015
category: cute, daniel, deep, emily, fun, funny, funny-quotes, green, hilarious, hilarious-quotes, humor, injury, inspirational, maybe, ollyvia, pain, paint, quote

quote: I can’t get her out of my head
author: JJM

quote: But she remembered having told Archer once that you could not measure love on a scale of degrees, and now she understood that it was the same with pain. Pain might escalate upward and, just when you thought you'd reached your limit, begin to spread sideways, and spill out, and touch other people, and mix with their pain. And grow larger, but somehow less oppressive. She had thought herself trapped in a place outside the ordinary feeling lives of people; she had not noticed how many people were trapped in that place with her.
author: Kristin Cashore, Fire

quote: Embrace life with hope than despair.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: There are days where you feel like shit ,torn apart,empty ,like it's hell .Well don't worry ,it does get better this hell of yours is what makes you find your happy path in life again.Why ?because during this hell all your pieces come out together and your task is to put them together and find who you really are.
author: Amira -Fadil

quote: We were despised and trampled upon but the Lord lifted us.

quote: I know an alcoholic is the worse, but sometimes I wonder if it's better to have a drinking father that lives at home, or a drinking father, that never comes around.
author: Anthony Liccione
category: absence, absorbed, acceptance, addiction, alcoholic, beer, dead-beat, distracted, drinking, family, father, fatherly-figure, gone, inattentive, not-paying-attention, pain, preoccupied, rejection, role-model, substance-abuse, unknown, vague, withdrawn, worse

quote: A small hole in his shirt revealed a gooey red blob right in the meaty part above his armpit, blood pouring from the wound. It hurt. It hurt bad. If he’d thought his headache downstairs had been tough, this was like three or four of those, all smashed into a coil of pain right there in his shoulder. And spreading through the rest of his body.Newt was at his side, looking down with worried eyes.“He shot me.” It just came out, a new number one on the list of the dumbest things he’d ever said. The pain, like living metal staples running through his insides, pricking and scratching with their little sharp points. He felt his mind going dark for the second time that day.
author: James Dashner, The Scorch Trials
category: dumb, gladers, hurt, minho, newt, pain, the-maze-runner, the-scorch-trials, thomas, wound

quote: The pain of the journey should challenge you to make change, the vision of what could be drives you forward.
author: Tony Curl

quote: My youth is like a scab: under it there is a wound that every day leaks blood. It disfigures me.
author: Gottfried Benn

quote: Yes, the life of an adult entails accepting and in some way being responsible for pain.
author: James A. Autry

quote: Can we just be grateful for beauty & joy, fascination & tolerance, humour & love, nature & grace, and simply release any anger and pains?
author: Jay Woodman
category: anger, grateful-attitude, grateful-quotes, gratefulness, gratefulness-quotes, humour, hurt, joy, love, nature, pain

quote: Sometimes, when it seems like the pain is never going to end, I wish I’d gotten a different suite of magical talents from my mother. Like the power to avoid situations that end with me willingly jamming my arm into a door made entirely from animate, apparently angry rose briars.
author: Seanan McGuire, A Red-Rose Chain

quote: I'd like to go back to five years old again. Just sometimes. To be turning over rocks and looking for pill bugs and holding earthworms, playing dolls, erecting forts, digging through dirt for marbles, burrowing in leaf piles, failing at igloo building, when my biggest concern was going to sleep with the lights off. I wish I was five again, before things got hard, before I was forced to grow up way too early and been stuck in this "adult" thing way too long. I wish I could sit in my Grandpa's lap and let him sing me crazy Irish songs and go over the names of the planets. "Gwampa, tell me about Outer Space." ... "Gwampa, sing the Swimming Song."I wish I could go back there, just for a little while, and pick raspberries by myself in the sun and find secret hideaways and not hurt, not worry, not carry the heavy things. If I could be five years old....just for a few minutes. Remember what it felt like to be free. That would be something.
author: Jennifer DeLucy
category: adulthood, being-young, childhood, fear, growing-up, memories, pain

quote: Never take the goals and aspirations along with your corpse. Rather execute... they doth entertain and enthrall the world around you!
author: AnilChandra
category: death, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, life, motivational, pain, philosophy, sarcasm, world

quote: If it´s cold and cloudy outside,And you want to be a great fella,Make all your troubles go glideOpening a smile as your umbrella.
author: Ana Claudia Antunes, The DAO (Dancing As One) Workbook Illustrated
category: attitude, attitude-quotes, effort, life, pain, problems-quotes, troubles-quotes, umbrella

quote: ...his tortured voice lost in the much grander cries of the world around him.
author: Osman Welela, Of Men Made Gods

quote: ...pain that would have made even a god shiver in terror.
author: Osman Welela, Of Men Made Gods

quote: Why is it a man can never seem to buckle down and train himself to indolence and stupidity when he can see what sanctuary they offer from toil and pain?
author: Alan LeMay

quote: The pain we cause will haunt our memories and eat at our souls. I do not seek forgiveness, only the emptiness of death.
author: Harley King

quote: The divine force within you is mightier than any mountain.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: Only the weak in spirit causes others pain.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: mindset, pain, self, self-help, spirit, weakness

quote: In times of adversity and affliction, may you wait for the Lord to rescue and deliver you.

category: adversity, courage, despair, difficult-times, endurance, fighting-spirit, hard-times, healing, inner-strength, limit, overcoming-obstacles, pain, positive, positive-outlook, strength, willpower

author: Ana Claudia Antunes, The DAO (Dancing As One) Workbook Illustrated
category: careless, chill-out, dao, drain, effort, exercise, flow, free, happiness, illustrated, life, motion, moves, ocean, pain, workbook, zen

quote: Rose lived the same life I did, but she doesn’t have PTSD. No bad dreams, no missing memories. Sometimes I’m jealous that she seems to deal with everything better than I do. But then I’ll catch her with this hollow look in her eyes and think maybe she just disguises everything for my benefit.Maybe she’s broken on the inside too.
author: Paula Stokes, Vicarious

quote: It's strange how can lose things that are still right there. How a barrier can go up at any moment, trapping you on the other side, keeping you from what you want. How the things that hurt the most are things we once had.
author: Robyn Schneider, Extraordinary Means

quote: Suffering is imposed on us time and again so that one day we would become brave wise masters. That is, a strong being who is confidently aware of their intended direction in life, and fearlessly adding value to the world and their future.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: attitude, awreness, becoming, believe-in-yourself, brave, confidence, courage, earth, empower, empowerment, evolve, evolving, experiences, faith, fear, fearless, future, grow, growing, heal, healing, life, master, motivation, nourish, obstacles, obstacles-make-you-stronger, pain, path, problems, strength, strong, suffer, suffering, time, value, wisdom, wise, world

quote: Life had taught her that consequences were ugly and painful, and seldom worth the pleasure they had been bartered for.
author: Amy Harmon, Prom Night in Purgatory
category: barter, consequences, cost, exchange, karma, lesson, life, pain, painful, pleasure, result, reward, taught, teach, ugly, worth

quote: The truth might hurt but lies hurt even more.
author: Rob Liano
category: growth, hurt, learning, lies, life, pain, people, relationships, self-esteem, self-worth, truth

quote: Rationality is the recognition of the fact that existence exists, that nothing can alter the truth and nothing can take precedence over that act of perceiving it, which is thinking—that the mind is one’s only judge of values and one’s only guide of action—that reason is an absolute that permits no compromise—that a concession to the irrational invalidates one’s consciousness and turns it from the task of perceiving to the task of faking reality—that the alleged short-cut to knowledge, which is faith, is only a short-circuit destroying the mind—that the acceptance of a mystical invention is a wish for the annihilation of existence and, properly, annihilates one’s consciousness.
author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged
category: atlas-shrugged, evil, good, happiness, john-galt, life, man, mind, morality, morals, objectivism, pain, philosophy, pursuit-of-happiness, rational, reason, think, thinking, truth, values, virtue, wisdom

quote: Independence is the recognition of the fact that yours is the responsibility of judgment and nothing can help you escape it—that no substitute can do your thinking—that the vilest form of self-abasement and self-destruction is the subordination of your mind to the mind of another, the acceptance of an authority over your brain, the acceptance of his assertions as facts, his say-so as truth, his edicts as middle-man between your consciousness and your existence.
author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged
category: atlas-shrugged, evil, good, happiness, independence, john-galt, life, man, mind, morality, morals, objectivism, pain, philosophy, pursuit-of-happiness, rational, reason, think, thinking, truth, values, virtue, wisdom

quote: We are taught to fear anything that can bring us closer to death — to keep us from taking huge leaps that involve risk. The only thing you should fear in this lifetime is not taking risks while you are living. I do not mean to go jump off a bridge. I mean, to go all out to reach your dreams, to dare to do things you typically would not do out of fear. Pain has a threshold and so does death. Fear neither, and never fear what has no right to be feared.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: being, bridge, dare, death, doing, dreams, dying, fear, feared, fearful, fearless, leaps, life, living, pain, risk, risks, risktaker, success, suzy-kassem, threshold

quote: There are just traces of me and not a shadow left…Without the traces of your iridescence to make my silhouette.
author: Deepa Bajaj
category: love, love-hurts, love-quotes, lovequotes, pain, separation

quote: We are all prisoners of circumstance at one point or another.
author: Andrea Cremer, The Inventor's Secret

quote: We learn from pain that some of the things we thought were castles turn out to be prisons, and we desperately want out, but even though we built them, we can't find the door. Yet maybe if you ask God for help in knowing which direction to face, you'll have a moment of intuition. Maybe you'll see at least one next right step you can take.
author: Anne Lamott, Help Thanks Wow: The Three Essential Prayers

quote: In AP Bio, I learned that the cells in our body are replaced every seven years, which means that one day I'll have a body full of cells that were never sick. But it also means that the parts of me that knew and loved Sadie will disappear. I'll still remember loving her, but it'll be a different me who loved her. And maybe this is how we move on. We grow new cells to replace the grieving ones, diluting our pain until it loses potency.
author: Robyn Schneider, Extraordinary Means

quote: Stretched and skewedTap of the 8-ball and the cueScratches fall throughThey are the scars of you
author: Criss Jami, Salomé: In Every Inch In Every Mile
category: 8-ball, billiards, clever, cue-ball, hurt, lies, love, lyrics, metaphor, pain, poetry, pool, rejection, rhyming, scars, scratch, skewed, songwriting, sports, stretched, suffering

quote: No, you do not have to live as a man; it is an act of moral choice. But you cannot live as anything else—and the alternative is that state of living death which you now see within you and around you, the state of a thing unfit for existence, no longer human and less than animal, a thing that knows nothing but pain and drags itself through its span of years in the agony of unthinking self-destruction.
author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged
category: atlas-shrugged, evil, good, happiness, john-galt, life, man, mind, morality, morals, objectivism, pain, philosophy, pursuit-of-happiness, rational, reason, think, thinking, truth, values, virtue, wisdom

quote: Know that blank pages feel the urge of the ink as much as tears paint a different pain, changes
author: Goitsemang Sandra Mvula

quote: Could you keep your heart in wonder at the daily miracles of your life, your pain would not seem less wondrous than your joy;
author: Kahlil Gibran, The Prophet
category: heart, joy, life, miracles, pain, painful, sorrow, wonder

quote: Her eyes stung from crying for so long and having some tears dry on them. Her body was weak from the exercise but she did not feel better. While she was crying she had wanted someone, anyone to come and hold her. She had crawled into her closet, hoisted herself up onto the shelf that had duvets and bedsheets and curled herself among those. Now she knew that no hug could erase her pain, no sort of embrace could bind up her heart. She needed a new heart it seemed, her old heart was beyond repair.
author: Roxanna Aliba Kazibwe
category: heartache, hope, life-and-living, love-story, pain, rebirth

quote: Loneliness gave me things that no one did. It gave me pain, It gave me strength to gather myself and stand again. It gave me strength to wait for you.
author: Srinivas Shenoy

quote: In the storm, our only anchor is hope.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: achieve, adversity, anchor, believe, challenges, determination, difficulty, focus, hang, hope, life, overcome, overcoming-depression, pain, perseverance, positive, positive-thinking, problems, self-help, self-motivation, storm, troubles

quote: Besides the pain in my gut, why shouldn't I laugh? I've almost escaped death in a foreign country.
author: S.A. Tawks, Mule
category: adventure, bali, capital-punishment, death, drugs, indonesia, pain, travel

quote: Still, his apartment has that dreamlike qualityof feeling like home though I know it’s not. Not mine anymore — but how many people get to visit the past without hurting anything?To come back and drink the same coffeefrom the same never-quite-clean cup?
author: Jameson Fitzpatrick

quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.Even as the stone of the fruit must break, that its heart may stand in the sun, so must you know pain.
author: Kahlil Gibran, The Prophet
category: break, breaking, heart, joy, pain, pains, sadness, sorrow

quote: You can't compare and rank heartache. Pain is pain is pain. There is no precise measurement. No quarter cup.
author: Kaui Hart Hemmings, The Possibilities

quote: Difficulties of life are valuable opportunities for self-discovery.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: When you face any difficulty, do not panic but pray.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: believe, christian, despair, determined-person, disappointment, emotional, faith, hard-times, healing, inspirational-life, life, life-philosophy, pain, panic, positive, positive-attitude, positive-thinking, prayer-life, praying-life, self-help, self-motivation, struggles, survival-instinct, troubles

quote: Whoever you are. Where ever you are. With whom so ever you are & were. Whatever may be your past. What so ever may be the truth. I will wait for you & I will fade away just like a daffodil when storm comes.
author: Srinivas Shenoy

quote: When someone comes around at that dreary moment, when all hope was lost, and thorns emerged. And that fellow, walks on that thorn just to cross to your side, to bear the pains for your sake, to bleed, to self-destroy himself, just to protect you. He places you above his priorities, and doesn't give a damn whatsoever taunt he receives, his foremost desire is to make sure you are save, feel loved and cared for, and that's the true definition of love.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson, The Infinity Sign
category: bleed, crave, definition-of-love, emotions, everlasting-love, heart-to-heart, i-love-you, love, love-quotes, michael-bassey-johnson, moments, moments-lived-with-love, pain, poetry, promise, thorns, together, true-friends, true-friendship, true-love

quote: This pain is comfort. It is the solace of physicality, like a touch.
author: Johnny Rich, The Human Script
category: comfort, feelings, pain, self-harm, suicide, touch

quote: ... some wounds refuse the remedy of time.
author: Robert McCammon, Speaks the Nightbird

quote: The more you try to protect yourself from love, the more pain you bring to yourself and those that love you
author: April Mae Monterrosa

quote: The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain.Is not the cup that holds your wine the very cup that was burned in the potters oven?And is not the lute that soothes your spirits the very wood that was hollowed with knives?
author: Kahlil Gibran, The Prophet
category: happiness, highs-and-lows, joy, joyful, pain, sadness, sorrow, sorrowful

quote: One major cost of self-deception is that we use painful life experiences to justify being non-ideal versions of ourselves.
author: Cortney S. Warren, Lies We Tell Ourselves: The Psychology of Self-Deception
category: cost, experiences, justify, life, major, non-ideal, ourself, pain, self-deception, version

quote: I should love her like there is an ache that won't go away unless I'm with her.
author: Amy A. Bartol, Under Different Stars

quote: My body is cracking from the pain I have swallowed so Many times, heaving with sobs I can no longer suppress, my dignity dissolving in my tears, the agony of these past few days ripping my skin to shreds.
author: Tahereh Mafi, Shatter Me

quote: Do not run away from your challenges. You must endure and overcome each challenge.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: adversity, advice, brave, brave-heart, challenges, conquer, daily-inspiration, determined-person, encouragement, endure, enduring-hardships, fearless, fearless-bravery, good-intentions, good-life, hardtimes, inner-strength, life-philosophy, obstacles, overcome, overcomer, overcoming-adversity, overcoming-challenges, pain, positive, positive-outlook, positive-thinking, self-motivation, strength-of-spirit, uplifting, will-power

quote: We would all benefit by shifting our focus from seeing pain as bad to seeing pain as motivation to change.
author: Cortney S. Warren, Lies We Tell Ourselves: The Psychology of Self-Deception

quote: Be free to do what you want to... before the time is through.
author: RSCruz
category: freedom, freedom-quotes, heartache, love, pain, regrets, time-passing, time-slipping, waiting-quotes

quote: It’s not that I don’t suffer, it’s that I know the unimportance of suffering, I know that pain is to be fought and thrown aside, not to be accepted as part of one’s soul and as a permanent scar across one’s view of existence.
author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged

quote: Don't turn your head. Keep looking at the bandaged place. That's where the light enters you.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Write about fear. Write about pain. Write about heartache and resentment. Nothing worth reading comes from writing what can be said out loud.
author: Alexandra Cruz

quote: She survived it. She was able to survive it, because she did not believe in suffering. She faced with astonished indignation the ugly fact of feeling pain, and refused to let it matter. Suffering was a senseless accident, it was not part of life as she saw it.
author: Ayn Rand, Atlas Shrugged

quote: The truth is that pain is not inherently bad for us
author: pain is information.
category: Cortney S. Warren, Lies We Tell Ourselves: The Psychology of Self-Deception

quote: They’re scared of the other kind of love. The one which lacks hurt, but pains after awhile.
author: Dominic Riccitello
category: afraid, fear, hurt, love, pain, quote, relationship, scared, thoughts

quote: She surveyed the undergrowth and focused on a cluster of fern fronds curled tightly against the new life they had been given. She often wondered why the fern’s new existence was so firmly wound up. But she questioned their response no longer. Oaklee felt every muscle in her body want to curl up in self-protection, to comfort the pain, anger, and fear.
author: Jesikah Sundin, Elements
category: anger, elements, fear, ferns, pain, self-protection, the-biodome-chronicles, willow

quote: I wonder what will happen when you actually enjoy the pains that life gives us sometimes. You'll be above them.
author: Innocent Mwatsikesimbe, The Reason
category: courage, disappointment, failure, heartbreak, inspirational, life, maturity, motivational, pain, success

quote: It is the nature of human that we tend to pass our pain along. As if we could get rid of it by inflicting an equal hurt on someone else.
author: Robin Hobb

quote: You'll notice that pain isn't solid or constant but rather a series of sensations, sometimes hard, sometimes light, and even sometimes gone altogether
author: Ruby Wax, Sane New World: Taming The Mind
category: health, inspirational, mental-health, mentality, mindfulness, pain, ruby-wax, science, true

quote: In friendship you are free, you don’t hurt much. But love when comes to hurt hollows your identity, peace, mind and body so intensely making blank mind.
author: Sadashivan Nair, Negative-Positive and We

quote: May God protect us from every calamity.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: adversity, believe-in-god, calamity, challenges, christian, deliever, despair, faith, god, gods-grace, hope, inspiring, pain, pray, protection, saved-souls

quote: Give me all your pain, I will give you all my love!
author: Preeth Nambiar

quote: Lord keep us from all evil so that our lives will be free of pain.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: calling-people, christian, christian-living, deliverance, emotional-pain, faith, gods-grace, healing, living-life, mercy, pain, positive-thinking, pray, praying-life, protection, save-souls, shield, uplifting

quote: But pain is an impatient customer. It wouldn't be long before it demanded attention.
author: Jill Alexander Essbaum

quote: The human body may need to receive sunlight through the tree canopy in order to be in a healthy state. I call this light “Interference Green Light” and it may be the top thing that you need to be receiving in order to be in good health and free of pain.
author: Steven Magee, Solar Radiation, Global Warming and Human Disease
category: body, canopy, free, good, green, health, healthy, human, interference, light, order, pain, receive, state, sunlight, top, tree

quote: Lord heal the broken hearted.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: christian, death, despair, emotional, faith, healing, healthy-habits, hope, inspiring, loss, mercy, pain, pray, prayer-life, warfare-prayers

quote: Ya got cigarettes?” she asks. “Yes,” I say,“I got cigarettes.” “Matches?” she asks.“Enough to burn Rome.” “Whiskey?”“Enough whiskey for a Mississippi River of pain.” “You drunk?” “Not yet.
author: Charles Bukowski
category: cigarettes, drinking, drowning-one-s-sorrows, drowning-sorrows, pain, poem, poetry, smoking, through-the-streets-of-anywhere, whiskey

quote: Nobody can see pain. They have no frame of reference for pain that's happening to someone else. They can only see inactivity - which they interpret as laziness.
author: Elizabeth Haynes, Human Remains
category: disability, illness, life, life-lessons, mental-health, pain

quote: Fake love, is just as damaging as open hate.
author: Anthony Liccione
category: damage, fake, hate, hide, hurt, love, open, pain

quote: Embrace the pain, Sharum.
author: Peter V. Brett, The Desert Spear

quote: You know what happens when you slide your cheek on the edge of a sharp razor blade? Yes! That's how it feels when you slide your dreams into the palms of toxic and negative people! Save your dreams from defamation and disfigurement!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Daily Drive 365
category: bad-people, big-dreams, bleeding, cheek, cuts, defamation, defame, destroy, devil, disfigure, disfigurement, dream-big, dream-killers, dreams, evil, food-for-thought, injury, israelmore-ayivor, negative-people, pain, painful, palms, people, sharp-blade, toxic, toxic-people, wound

quote: Ahab and aguish lay stretched together in one hammock.
author: Herman Melville, Moby-Dick or, The Whale
category: ahab, anguish, beautiful-language, captain-ahab, pain, physical-pain

quote: Everyone hurts us. If we stopped loving them because of pain, we'd never love anyone.
author: Courtney C. Stevens, The Blue-Haired Boy
category: bhie, courtney-stevens, love, loving, pain, the-blue-haired-boy

quote: I’m not capable of suffering completely. I never have. It goes only down to a certain point and then it stops. As long as there is that untouched point, it’s not really pain.
author: Ayn Rand, The Fountainhead

quote: Love is like slamming into a wall of concrete and asking to do it all again once the rubble is cleared.
author: Alexandra Toscano
category: boyfriend, break-ups, girlfriend, love, pain, relationships

quote: We do not know the worth of one single drop of blood, one single tear.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: Be strong. You will overcome the challenge.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: challenge, despair, difficult-life, difficult-times, disappointment, emotional-abuse, emotions, fighting-spirit, hard-times, healing, hope, inner-strength, inspiring, overcome, overcomer, overcoming-obstacles, pain, positive, problem, self-determination, self-help, surviving-life, surviving-spirit, troubles, uplifting, your-life

quote: She found a dark satisfaction in pain—because that pain came from him.
author: Ayn Rand, The Fountainhead
category: desire, dominique-francon, howard-roark, love, pain, the-fountainhead

quote: The worst pain you can imagine is when something you love goes away and nothing you can do will ever bring it back.
author: M.K. Meredith, Malibu Betrayals

quote: When love plays your life, and left you nothing but a memory of a broken heart heart,let the pain runs out in your eyes, it will make you feel better.Don't think you're strong when you're not, it will only makes you feel weaker.Be wise, accept, forgive and forget with no regret.
author: Bradley B. Dalina

quote: The evidence of death is before my eyes constantly. Moving from me outward. My death always a step in advance. The world is a mirror of myself dying. The world not dying anymore than I die. I more alive a hundred years from now. Than at this very moment.
author: Lydia Lunch
category: awareness, dark, death, deep-thinking, pain, rude-hieroglyphics, spoken-word

quote: In the preshent human condition, pain is unavoidable. As long as you inhabit a physical body, you have to experience pain from time to time. Suffering is of a different nature. It is a reaction of the manas/mind that magnifies the pain and adds various emotional frills and thrills to it. In many cases, pain is only transient; but if one wishes, one can always add to it and suffer more - there is no limit.
author: Samuel Sagan

quote: A person you loved has used you and hurt you, but there are more people to love, new paths to pursue, and noble tasks that only you can accomplish-for you and for your entire kingdom. If you must dwell on something dwell on that.
author: Kelli Swofford Nielsen, Journey to the Fringe

quote: Sometimes people come to heal your pain and end up by giving you bit more of that
author: Paul karan

quote: When love plays your life, and left you nothing but a memory of a broken heart,let the pain runs out in your eyes, it will make you feel better.Don't think you're strong when you're not, it will only makes you feel weaker.Be wise, accept, forgive and forget with no regret.
author: Bradley B. Dalina

quote: Pain is knowledge, knowledge is to heal the future.
author: Sixeye

quote: Without pain, how would we know what true joy feels like?
author: Tim Hiller, Strive: Life is Short, Pursue What Matters

quote: ...baby, it's never an insult to be called what somebody thinks is a bad name. It just shows how poor that person is, it doesn't hurt you. So don't let Mrs Dubose get you down. She had enough troubles or her own.
author: Harper Lee
category: bad-names, calling-names, hurt, insult, pain, poor, trouble

quote: No other creature on the face of this planet inflicts more suffering than humans.
author: Mischa Temaul
category: animals, earth, human, humanity, humans, humans-and-animals, life, pain, planet, suffering

quote: You reach a point where the pain gets so acute you do not feel it anymore, but to reach that point, you experience so much pain that you're unable to forget the suffering that led you there.
author: Christopher Rees

quote: I can see her struggling to find the right word. Death seems so harsh. Passing so oblique. Some things are beyond words, I suppose, and she never finishes the statement. It seems right, that her words should fall into oblivion; after all, she—like me, like everyone—has no words for what follows, for the unknowable, only her hopes and prayers and an unwavering faith in something more.
author: Kelseyleigh Reber, If I Resist
category: afterlife, beyond-words, death, faith, faithfulness, hope-and-healing, loss, lost-for-words, moving-on-and-letting-go, no-words, oblivion, pain, prayers, suffering

quote: Don't leave the classroom of pain without gathering wisdom from its instruction.
author: Tim Hiller, Strive: Life is Short, Pursue What Matters

quote: Complicated things CHALLENGE us most,HURTS us most,and there, we LEARN the most.
author: Bradley B. Dalina
category: bradley-b-dalina, challenge, complicated, hurt, learn, pain

quote: And it seemed as though for a moment, the world encapsulated them in a giant sigh. As if the world was exhausted by humanity—by the bellows of war and bullets, of hateful cries and grieving tears. Of all the pain, the endless pain humanity had brought into its peaceful existence. A great heaving sigh to wash it all away. But like the sea, when washed away, war only crashed harder, a surging line of arched backs and brackish tears.
author: Kelseyleigh Reber
category: cruelty, human-condition, humanity, life, mankind-nature, pain, suffering, war, world

quote: Reframing your past painful experiences and seeing them in a humorous light takes away the power and emotional charge attached to the memory of the hurtful event.
author: Miya Yamanouchi, Embrace Your Sexual Self: A Practical Guide for Women
category: humour, laugher, laughing, laughter-is-he-best-medicine, life-experiences, life-lessons, pain, painful-past

quote: Art is pain. And so is life.
author: Robyn Schneider, Extraordinary Means

quote: I shook again, tasted plum, and suddenly the words were pouring out of me."She said I sang before I spoke. She said when I was just a baby she had the habit of humming when she held me. Nothing like a song. Just a descending third. Just a soothing sound. Then one day she was walking me around the camp, and she heard me echo it back to her. Two octaves higher. A tiny piping third. She said it was my first song. We sang it back and forth to each other. For years."I choked and clenched my teeth."You can say it,"Auri said softly."It's okay if you say it.""I'm never going to see her again,"I choked out. Then I began to cry in earnest."It's okay,"Auri said softly."I'm here. You're safe.
author: Patrick Rothfuss, The Wise Man's Fear
category: auri, baby, crying, friendship, kvothe, longing-for-past, love, my-first-song, pain, plum, safe, song

quote: You are afraid to let anyone in, but you still leave the door open, hoping someone good will shut the door behind him and throw away the keys.
author: Jenim Dibie, The Calligraphy of God
category: dreams, heartbreak, hope, inspirational, life, loss, love, misery, pain, poems, poetry, scars, walls, wounds

quote: I write, write and write but I can't find words that define what I feel inside.
author: Azereth Skivel

quote: Heaven left a hole in your heart. But it’s up to you to choose if that hole will be filled with pain, anger, and the eternal darkness of loss . . .	Or if you will choose to fill it with light and love and have that hole shine out of you like a spotlight into your life, keeping their memory alive . . .{It’s up to you.}
author: Tessa Shaffer, Heaven Has No Regrets
category: anger, courage-quotes, grief-and-loss, grief-inspirational, grieving-loss, heaven, heaven-has-no-regrets, heaven-quotes, inspirational-life, inspirational-love, inspirational-quotes, loss, memorial, memory-loss, no-regrets, pain, remembering-loved-ones

quote: Anyone could see that this woman is living a nightmare. Except that she goes through her daily life wide awake, knowing that she could make a mistake at any moment.
author: Núria Añó
category: awake, courage, domestic-violence, dv, feminism, freedom, gender, gender-inequality, hypocrisy, identity, integrity, leave-home, leave-the-past, misogyny, mistake, nuria-ano, pain, painfully, realism, reason, self-awareness, self-determination, woman, women, women-s-day, women-s-rights

quote: I knew that suffering can purify, that it's a kind of fire that can be worth enduring, but there were degrees of it to which I chose not to subject myself.
author: Dean Koontz, Saint Odd
category: avoidance, fire, grief, odd-thomas, pain, purifying, suffering

quote: It is an unwritten rule of life that when you are in acute pain and have no one to console you, someone, from somewhere, will emerge in your life to offer you comfort. However, ‘that’ someone will vanish from the scene once you begin to regain grip on your life, leaving you with another sense of loss to nurse.
author: Hari Parameshwar, Chase of Choices
category: comfort, loss, pain, rules, someone, somewhere-in-time

quote: Sometimes you try to fly and you fall. Remember your falls are not fatal, they're just a little painful. Endure the pain, clean the blood stain, you'll surely gain! Get up and fly again!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Daily Drive 365
category: blood, blood-stain, clean, endure, fall, fatal, fly, fly-again, food-for-thought, gain, gainful, get-up, israelmore-ayivor, little, pain, painful, stain

quote: One of the things he had learned in life, and which he hoped he could rely on, was that a greater pain drives out a lesser one. A strained muscle disappears before toothache, toothache disappears before a crushed finger. He hoped - it was his only hope now - that the pain of cancer, the pain of dying , would drive out the pains of love. It did not seem likely.
author: Julian Barnes

quote: Be willing to pass through a short term pain so that you can come out with a long term gain. Don't fear the horrible waves of the waters
author: just dare to cross and you get there!

quote: Sometimes I wish I could feel more painso I could touch that much more beauty.
author: Edward Fahey, The Mourning After
category: beauty, growth, pain, sensitivity, spirit, spiritual-growth, spiritual-quotes, theosophy

quote: We must graciously endure the times.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: advice, ambition, belief, challenges, christian, daily-inspiration, despair, disappointment, educational-philosophy, endurance, failures, faith, gods-power, grace-of-god, hope, inner-strength, life-philosophy, motivational, obstacles, overcoming-adversity, pain, positive, positive-motivation, purpose-driven-life, self-help, strength-through-adversity, success, survival-instinct, time-travel

quote: Never expect someone to care for you or to care about your feelings and emotios Everyone's fucking heartless, people just don't give a damn about your stupid feelings or your boring stories. People only know how to fool you around and use you for their own benefits.
author: Taimoor Madni
category: broken, emotional, feelings, hearless, heartache, love, pain, relationship, sad

quote: As I sat up I turned my head to the side, but immediately straightened it again when I felt a sharp pain shoot through my neck.
author: Jennifer Starzec, 5k, Ballet, and a Spinal Cord Injury
category: adventure, chronic-illness, illness, inspirational, journey, motivational, nerve-pain, pain, paralysis, spinal-cord-injury, transverse-myelitis

quote: Man is not suffering by external forces as much as his own dysfunctional mind and self inflicted negative stimulus.
author: Aditya Ajmera

quote: That her own self-deception and self-absorption, her own slavery to the society and family in which she had been brought up, had reduced this blameless man to a weeping wreck struck her as horrific. She saw more clearly than she had ever seen before that she must change, or keep hurting the people who truly loved her.
author: Shamim Sarif, I Can't Think Straight
category: consequences, lesbian, lgbt, life-lessons, love, pain, unrequired-love

quote: Pain can mask itself as a righteous companion
author: silently forming a barrier between you & all that is good for you. Identify Pain. Now thank Pain for showing you that all of your senses & emotions are working as you send him on his way. Traveling with pain can slow you down & limit the distance you travel.

quote: Though I'm not sure, I thought I saw women dressed in black, with her head and face covered by a black veil, duck behind a tree as we approached the road and parked car. Hiding so we wouldn't see her. But I caught a glimpse, enough to reveal the rope of lustrous pearls she wore. Pearls that were there for a thin white hand to lift and nervously, out of long habit, twist and untwist into a knot. Only one women I knew did that--and she was the perfect one to wear black, and should run to hide!Forever hide! Color all her days black! Every last one!
author: V.C. Andrews
category: black, death, drama, family-drama, hatred, pain, petals-on-the-wind, revenge, v-c-andrews, vengeance

quote: The limitations in life do not necessary limit you.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: adversity, daily-life, destiny, determined-spirit, difficulties-of-life, educational, educational-philosophy, failures, fate, fighting-spirit, hard-times, healthy-mind, hope, inner-strength, inspirational, inspiring-thoughts, life-lesson, lifes-passions, lifestyle, limitation, motivation, obstacles, overcomer, overcoming-challenges, pain, purpose, shine-your-light, strength-of-will, success, wisdom, your-life, your-passion

quote: We will not open healed wounds!""My wounds are not healed!" I stated just as firmly. "They will never be healed until justice is done!
author: V.C. Andrews
category: grief, heal, healing, justice, pain, petals-on-the-wind, vc-andrews, wounds

quote: Just before the men closed the tail gate on the float, she strained her head to see me and nodded her head so hard her blonde mane flew around her face—she looked like she was standing in a cloud of icing sugar. She uttered such a quiet neigh, it seemed only I heard it. She stared at me, and closed her eyes. Then she was gone.
author: Kelly Batten, One Day You'll Find Me
category: breakup, clouds, girl, horse, icing-sugar, leaving, pain, sadness

quote: I’d like to think that the day I realize we will always be miserable will differ from every other. I hope it will so obnoxiously stand out from the monotonous cycle of my days, that I wouldn’t forget that sorrowful moment of comprehension. But, when that breeze of reality comes by, it wont be a memorable hurricane, nor a momentous tornado. It will be the same, sad, soft wind that I felt the day before, and the day before that. Because the moment you understand your inevitable misery in life, may also be the day you see you are to always be dejected.
author: Temperance
category: depressed, depressing, life, lonely, misery, pain, pessimistic, quotes, reality-check, sad, sadness, woody-allen

quote: I firmly believe that life will continually try to teach you the same lesson, with increasing pain, until you heed the call.
author: Chris Matakas, My Mastery: Continued Education Through Jiu Jitsu
category: awareness, growth, lessons, life, pain, personal-growth

quote: Jude taught me what love was: to be willing to hold on to another person's pain. That's it.
author: Stephanie Oakes, The Sacred Lies of Minnow Bly

quote: Pain only disables the weak.
author: Erika Johansen, The Invasion of the Tearling

quote: The true test of a warrior is how your 'stance' holds up after any 'circumstance'. Meaning, even after the stormiest weather, a true warrior will still reflect the brilliant rays of the magnificent sun through both his or her eyes. You may get hit by sudden lightning or take severe beatings from the cruel wind, but you will always get back up and stand strong on your feet again, soak in the sunlight, and be prepared to get hit by even the most merciless hail - time and time again.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: abuse, abuse-survivors, adversity, attitude, courage, get-back-up, inspirational, life, loss, obstacles, overcoming-adversity, overcoming-obstacles, pain, problems, relentless, stamina, strength, strength-through-adversity, success, sunlight, survivor, warrior, weather

quote: Life cracks us into unrecognizable shards of former incarnations. Slivers of our hurt and our pain and our shame nestles next to fragments of our truth, our divinity, our fierce reclamation of power.It is this very brokenness that allows us to knit together, kaleidoscope style. And we spin and shift and turn to the light until we appear brilliant, lit from within. Suddenly we are revealed; unexpected beauty born directly from brokenness.We have to be willing to break in order to become.
author: Jeanette LeBlanc
category: broken, depression, healing, heartbreak, hope, pain, recovery, resilience

quote: I was overpowered by the mere sensation of that dream and it alone survived in my sorely wounded heart.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky, The Dream of a Ridiculous Man
category: aspiration, dreams, emptiness, heart, hope, illusion, lifeless, pain, sadness, sensation, soulless, wounds

quote: In life you find pleasure. In life you find pain. Pain and pleasure is an example of the duality in life. Enjoy them both, they are part of the ride. The key is to not turn the pain into something else - regret.
author: J.R. Rim
category: bring-the-pain, enjoy, finding-bliss, fortitude, grit, no-regrets, pain, part-of-the-process, pleasure, regret, resilience, ride

quote: To live this life. To live it with wholeness and gratitude and trust. In the pain and the glory. In the mess and the grace. In the sacred and the desperation. This is the stuff of which real superheros are born.
author: Jeanette LeBlanc
category: grace, inspiration, inspirational, pain, resilience, strength-through-adversity, superheros

quote: Oh, sometimes I think it is of no use to make friends. They only go out of your life after a while and leave a hurt that is worse than the emptiness before they came.
author: L.M. Montgomery, Anne of Avonlea

quote: Often, things are left unsaid. Everyone is guilty of thinking and feeling things... of loving or appreciating others... and of taking for granted that those others will just be there... to continue to share life's journey with...Then when one is gone... so quickly... all those things left unsaid... they matter more, because they were unspoken...Everyone fights their own battles inside themselves... often no one outside them even knows the wars that rage inside even those who they are closest to...I'd like to take the time, here and now, to tell all of you... those close to me, and those who aren't... those who matter so much... and those who have influenced me in even the smallest ways... all of you... that you matter. You are important. You are appreciated. Don't for a moment think otherwise. Don't, for even an instant, think or feel that you are not a wonder... a gift to the world... that makes it a better place to be... or that it would ever, in any way, be anything less than a tragedy for you to leave before your time.
author: Dennis Sharpe
category: coping, for-granted, important, intervention, loss, love, pain, sorrow, tragedy, unspoken, uplifting

quote: Yes, some mistakes leave their mark, like the infidelity stains in the backseat. But in time they do fade.
author: Crystal Woods, Better to be able to love than to be loveable
category: backseat, fade, infidelity, mistakes, pain, relationships, sex, stains, time

quote: To be happy to be sad and sad to be happy is to sing an echo in that beautiful language called Sorrow.
author: Criss Jami, Healology
